bibl.title: Fletcher Decker v. State of Washington. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the United States District Court in and for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division
In the Matter of the Application of Fletcher Decker for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and Writ of Certiorari.
To the Honorable JEREMIAH NETERER, Judge of the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington:

Comes now the respondent, John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington,and produces the body of FLETCHER DECKER in obedience to the command and direction of the writ of habeas corpus in the above entitled matter, he being the person named in the petition for said writ.

For answer and return to said writ, respondent avers that he detained in his custody the body of FLETCHER DECKER for extradition from the United States, under and by virtue of a committment of United States Commissioner Robert W. McCelland issued to him the said respondent.

Respondent attaches hereto copy of the Testimony taken at the hearing, copy of original petition for extradition, copy of the Amended Petition for Extradition, copy of the Original Warrant authorizing the Marshal to arrest the Petitioner, copy of Bond for Recognizance, copy of the Judgment of Robert W. McClelland, copy of the Committment of Robert W. McClelland, and copy of Documentary Evidence produced at the hearing of petitioner, which constitute a part of this return.
And now the respondent having fully answered, he prays that said writ may be discharged.

JOHN M. BOYLE, being first duly sworn, on his oath deposes and says: That he is United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington named in the foregoing return; that he has read the said return and knows the contents thereof and that he believes the same to be true.
SUBSCRIBED, and sworn to before me this 8th day of September, 1921.
Deputy Clerk, U.S. District Court, Western District of Washington
